dict.string: Copyright 2022, The Octagon Variable Project Authors

“Octagon”, a contrasted sans serif design by Edwin Allen originally shown 1838 as wood type in George Nesbitt’s “First Premium Wood Types, Cut By Machinery.” was reimagined as a variable font, collaboratively redrawn and extended with the students at the Hochschule für Angewandte Wissenschaften in Hamburg in 2022 as part of a first year type design introduction class. “Octagon Variable” is an educational type design project developed by Prof. Pierre Pané-Farré and Simon Thiefes at the design department of the Hochschule für Angewandte Wissenschaften Hamburg, Finkenau 35, 22081 Hamburg.

Alexander Royter, Emma Schmalisch, Felix Willnauer, Friederike Temme, Greta Wachholz, Jason Tsiakas, Julia Baskal, Julia Schmidt, Kaja Wetzel, Kateryna Shelevytska, Lara Tamminga, Nina Vierke Liyani, Sania Salem, Sarah-Ann Röhlen, Sofiya Slyusarenko, Stina Scholz, Vanessa Schneider, Zoe Rygus with contributions by Pierre Pané-Farré and Simon Thiefes.
This Font Software is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1. This license is available with a FAQ at: https://scripts.sil.org/OFL
